page.title: 16HOUSING IN AYLESFORD AREA
page.content: There have been dwellings in the locality since Pre-Roman times.Existing housing stock dates from the early 17th century to post war.Afew houses in Aylesford and some farm houses exhibit Tudor,timber frame and ragstone contruction. 19th century terraced cottages built originally for local cement workers are a distinct feature of part of Eccles.Post-war development makes up most of the remaining housing stock in that village.A small number of pre-war houses,both local authority and private,are to be found on the outskirts of Aylesford.Central village housing is a mixture of 19th century terraced cottages and 20th century semi-detached pairs.The Kits Coty Estate (Bluebell hill) is an area of private housing of various types on large plots.
